message: Closing our first round this week
I strapped on some boots and got to work.
@jdunck Yes, but i left around the time it was launched to the public, in 2006. Eons ago. I guess there aren't many ex-twitter people applying for YC.
working on product in spare time while the runway's being built.
@rabble you were twitter?
Our own savings
So far, by a work bonus and a tax refund. Hopefully soon closing a municipal deal w/ grants.
self-funded through full time job
@timerickson haha. We did that too. :)
Bootstrapped
Mostly consulting/licensing related to our startup (making sure we kept most of the IP developed )

We've been running a consulting business developing products for clients. We use the money from that to set aside a team to focus on our own product. We're now spinning it off in to a separate subsidiary company.
self-funded with revenues from another product
Student loan
have been doing consulting for about a year, intentionally building runway to do this.
Self funded by doing freelance work in spare time.
So nobody selling cereal?
sold hats and imported electronics from Japan
good looks :-)
@simonify Doing the same with the team.
@jdunck Maybe, i mean i quit and went to work at yahoo brickhouse, which was even more of a mess than twitter was/is.
@rabble well, i was more identifying you as one smart dude; twitter was just a proxy to figure who you were ;-)

Yeah, it was funny, so many people thought fire eagle was acquired when we launched it. Y!Geo, where Fire Eagle ended up is also underfunded and full of political infighting. The rest of YGeo served the adplatform, we served end users, it was hard to get resources.
@rabble it was a fine gambit, a bright spot surrounded by decay.  i wish fire eagle were spun out :-/
@rabble I guess, there are not much of those out there, i think this can be a good point to have been involved on such project previously

bootstrapping - I'm consulting and my cofounder's in biz school
bootstrapped, and we're in the black makin' that dough.

Personal savings, personal and business lines of credit ready, and have talked to a couple top tier VCs, some seed funds, and mostly angels so far (although not actually asked for money yet, only advice).  Also planning to have revenue this summer.  We also still have passive income from other projects (server colo).  Worst case, a decent book of consulting revenue to implement our product for customers.
